title: Ticket #4339: condor_gpu_discovery crashes on Windows inside OpenCL detection
description:
condor_gpu_discovery crashes on windows when it attempts to detect OpenCL devices. The crash is inside the OpenCL library, during an attempt to get enumerate the devices.

This was reported on condor users, from the original post: 

condor_gpu_discovery -properties -verbose -opencl -diagnostic

diag: simulating cudart using nvcuda
using nvcuda.dll to simulate cudart
diag: ocl_Init()
ocl platform 0 = da2718
         NAME: "Intel(R) OpenCL"
         VERSION: "OpenCL 1.2 "
         VENDOR: "Intel(R) Corporation"
         PROFILE: "FULL_PROFILE"
         DEVICES = 0

Crash
remarks:
2014-May-06 11:03:21 by johnkn:
the problem was a mismatch on 32 bit platforms between the prototype for clGetDeviceIDs and the actual function, which lead to too more bytes being popped off the stack than were pushed. CL_DEVICE_TYPE changed to 64 bits on both 32 and 64 bit platforms fixes the prototype mismatch.
